data.title: The Resting Place of Sparrow David Thompson
data.meta_description:
Sir John Thompson was the fourth Prime Minister of Canada and the first Roman Catholic to hold that office. (I suspect many Canadians would guess that Wilfred Laurier, a Quebecker, was the first Catholic PM.) Thompson was initially offered the post after Sir John A Macdonald died, but he turned it down because he believed his religion would be politically unacceptable.
	
	Thompson went to London in 1894, where he was appointed to the Imperial Privy Counsel by Queen Victoria. While in Windsor Castle, Thompson suffered a fatal heart attack. He was only 49. After a funeral service arranged at the direction of the Queen, Thompson's body was returned to Canada on a frigate that was painted black for the trip.
	
	This is posted at Holy Cross Cemetery in Halifax, where Thompson is buried.
